generif.text: Molecular cloning and characterization of Strabismus 2
VANGL protein may serve as an effector mediating the intestinal trefoil factor (ITF) healing response of the intestinal mucosa.

In a protein-protein interaction assay V239I abolished interaction of VANGL1 protein with its binding partners, disheveled-1, -2, and -3. These findings implicate VANGL1 as a risk factor in human neural-tube defects.
VANGL1 increases invasion and migration of mouse squamous cancer cells and promotes pulmonary metastasis in a mouse squamous tumor model.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
role of VANGL1 as a risk factor in the development of spinal neural tube defects
This study demonstrates a high degree of functional conservation of VANGL genes across evolution and provides a model system for studying potential variants identified in human neural tube defects.
KITENIN plays an important role in human gastric cancer progression by AP-1 activation.
Loss of membrane targeting of Vangl1 and Vangl2 proteins causes neural tube defects.
a compact membrane-associated portion with very short predicted extra- and intracellular loops, while the protein harbors a large intracellular domain
KITENIN is associated with human colorectal cancer progression including invasion and metastasis.

NOS1AP colocalizes with both SCRIB and VANGL1 along cellular protrusions in metastatic breast cancer cells, but does not colocalize with either SCRIB or VANGL1 at cell junctions in normal breast cells
KITENIN is associated with tumor invasiveness and metastasis in human oral cavity squamous cell carcinoma.

The rs4839469 allele of VANGL1 was obviously associated with neural tube defects (NTDs). And genotype GC increased the risk of NTDs, changes in the three-dimensional protein structure may have impacted its biological functions.
The results show that the Vangl1 amino terminus lacks PM targeting determinants, and these are restricted to the carboxy terminus, including the predicted PDZBM motif at the C-terminus
Elevated KITENIN expression is associated with drug resistance in colorectal cancer.

Findings identify that KITENIN-targeting miR-124, miR-27a, and miR-30b function as endogenous inhibitors of colorectal cancer cell motility and demonstrate that miR-124 plays a suppressor role in colorectal tumorigenesis.
These results strongly suggest that R181 and R274 play critical roles in Vangl protein function and that their mutations cause neural tube defects in humans.
VANGL1 mutations are associated with neural tube defects.
High levels of KITENIN increased glioma invasiveness and progression, and are associated with the up-regulation of EMT and stemness markers.
Authors silenced VANGL1 gene expression in the HepG2 HCC cell line by stable transfection with a vector containing siRNA template for VANGL1 and investigated the change in cell invasion and motility.
Results found that KITENIN is associated with tumor progression by enhancing angiogenesis in colorectal cancer.
a novel and ultrasensitive sandwich-type immunosensor was fabricated to detect Vangl in human serum using C60-templated AuPt as labels and rGO-TEPA-PTC-NH2 as the platform.
We first propose the use of a DNA biosensor to detect the missense single nucleotide polymorphism (rs4839469 c.346G>A p.Ala116Thr) of the vangl1 gene
Study provides evidence that KITENIN functions in the maintenance of a higher expression level of ErbB4 in advanced colorectal cancer tissues, independent of ubiquitin-mediated degradation via Nrdp1.
two rare missense mutations in VANGL1, encoding a receptor involved in WNT/PCP signaling, may be associated with Adolescent Idiopathic Scoliosis
VANGL1 gene is not associated with Adolescent Idiopathic Scoliosis in the Chinese population
High KITENIN expression is associated with cholangiocarcinoma.
Circular RNA circ-VANGL1 is a competing endogenous RNA which contributes to bladder cancer progression by regulating miR-605-3p/VANGL1 pathway.
ErbB4/KITENIN-Mediated Signaling is Activated in Cetuximab-Resistant Colorectal Cancer Cells.
Circ-VANGL1 promotes the development of Osteoporosis via binding to miRNA-217 to downregulate RUNX2 expression.
Silencing circular RNA VANGL1 inhibits progression of bladder cancer by regulating miR-1184/IGFBP2 axis.
Somatic mutations in planar cell polarity genes in neural tissue from human fetuses with neural tube defects.
Up-regulation of VANGL1 by IGF2BPs and miR-29b-3p attenuates the detrimental effect of irradiation on lung adenocarcinoma.
Knockdown of circular RNA VANGL1 inhibits TGF-beta-induced epithelial-mesenchymal transition in melanoma cells by sponging miR-150-5p.
Deletions in VANGL1 are a risk factor for antibody-mediated kidney disease.
Myelomeningocele among Pakistani population.
Core planar cell polarity genes VANGL1 and VANGL2 in predisposition to congenital vertebral malformations.

BP.term: Wnt signaling pathway, planar cell polarity pathway

name: VANGL planar cell polarity protein 1

reactome.name: Signaling by Rho GTPases, Miro GTPases and RHOBTB3

summary: This gene encodes a member of the tretraspanin family. The encoded protein may be involved in mediating intestinal trefoil factor induced wound healing in the intestinal mucosa. Mutations in this gene are associated with neural tube defects. Alternate splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Feb 2010].
